Line 14: Line 14:
'''Twiggy''' (born '''Lesley Hornby'''; September 19, 1949) is an English [[Model (person)|model]], actress, and singer, now also known by her married name of '''Twiggy Lawson'''. A 1960s model known for her large eyes, long eyelashes, and thin build, she is regarded as one of the most famous models of all time. Twiggy went on to star in movies, and appeared as a judge on the reality show ''[[America's Next Top Model]]''. She now models for [[Marks and Spencer]] to promote their recent rebranding, and appears in seasonal TV adverts with others such as [[Myleene Klass]]'', ''as well as other forms of media for the campaigns.''
'''Twiggy''' (born '''Lesley Hornby'''; September 19, 1949) is an English [[Model (person)|model]], actress, and singer, now also known by her married name of '''Twiggy Lawson'''. A 1960s model known for her large eyes, long eyelashes, and thin build, she is regarded as one of the most famous models of all time. Twiggy went on to star in movies, and appeared as a judge on the reality show ''[[America's Next Top Model]]''. She now models for [[Marks and Spencer]] to promote their recent rebranding, and appears in seasonal TV adverts with others such as [[Myleene Klass]]'', ''as well as other forms of media for the campaigns.''
â

==Early life==
==Early life==
Twiggy was raised in the London [[suburb]] of [[Neasden]], the daughter of Helen (Nellie) Lydia Hornby ([[married and maiden names|nÃ©e]] Reeman), a counter-girl at a [[Woolworths Group plc|Woolworth's]] store and [[factory]] worker at a printing firm, and William Norman Hornby, a master carpenter and [[joiner]].<ref>[http://www.nationsmemorybank.com/editorial/fashion_article_3.html Nations Memory Bank: Page<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.filmreference.com/film/80/Twiggy.html Twiggy Biography (1949-)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> She attended the [[Queens Park Community School|Brondesbury and Kilburn High School]] in Salusbury Road, [[Kilburn, London|Kilburn]].<ref>[http://www.famouspeople.co.uk/t/twiggy.html Twiggy - Twiggy Biography, Career, Profile, Model, Filmography, Life<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Twiggy was raised in the London [[suburb]] of [[Neasden]], the daughter of Helen (Nellie) Lydia Hornby ([[married and maiden names|nÃ©e]] Reeman), a counter-girl at a [[Woolworths Group plc|Woolworth's]] store and [[factory]] worker at a printing firm, and William Norman Hornby, a master carpenter and [[joiner]].<ref>[http://www.nationsmemorybank.com/editorial/fashion_article_3.html Nations Memory Bank: Page<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.filmreference.com/film/80/Twiggy.html Twiggy Biography (1949-)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> She attended the [[Queens Park Community School|Brondesbury and Kilburn High School]] in Salusbury Road, [[Kilburn, London|Kilburn]].<ref>[http://www.famouspeople.co.uk/t/twiggy.html Twiggy - Twiggy Biography, Career, Profile, Model, Filmography, Life<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
